instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.R7105: What is R7105? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message:
Hi

Got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No liquid.
Client left with us as dead. No light on charger.
DC IN board blown, replaced and same story.
Replaced ISL its back to life but it charge battery only when Mac is turned off or when system is running its idle.
When some aps are opened which need some performance from Mac then is stop charging and % of battery going down with charger plugged in.

Same story with another ISL and with new battery.

<RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR>, R5381showing correct resIstance

Resistance in <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>:
Pin 27/28 21.5 Ohm
Pin 17/18 3.2 Ohm

Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message: Voltage on PPBUS from the charger only and then with the battery and charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message:
Charger only PPBUS got 12.50V
Charger and battery PPBUS got 11.45V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message: Charger 85W and recognized as such in OSX?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message:
Is this a known good charger, try another one even if it is a 60W.

Other than that check <RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR> and soldering on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR> is fine with 20 Ohms
Soldering on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> looks good and all pads got connection with components.

Same issue with three genuine 85W charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message: Boot it up with battery and then disconnect it. See what PPBUS does when you load the system, see if it stays at 12.5V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message:
System loaded with charger and battery PPBUS got 12.18V
Battery disconnected and PPBUS got 12.87V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message: PPBUS is too high. <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>/35 are suspect. Double check resistance between 17/18 and 27/28 too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message:
27/28 21.3 Ohm
17/18 3.1 Ohm

I did not replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>/35 because from some reason board wont boot anymore.
ISL getting VERY hot within a second. Changed twice and same issue.

Do you still recommend to replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>/35.

At the begging when DC-IN board was replaced ISL was very hot as well, but then I just replaced and board was working but not charging.
Now is same issue but new ISL wont help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message: Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>/35 and the ISL all together. ISL kills the FETS and the FETS kill the ISL so replace them all in 1 go.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message:
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>/35 and the ISL and was working again.
Was even charging during GPU stress test and % was going up, but when I connected clients charger it stop charging during stress test.
I checked charger and its genuine 85W charger.

Do you think charger can kill <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>/35 and the ISL?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge when need more power.
threads.message: Unlikely but possible. Is it a Chinese garbage charger? Keep in mind that these machines may not charge during 100% CPU/GPU load. The percentage should not go down though.
